refnamediv.refpurpose: Add words to a free text update batch.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para:
This function allows you to add words to a free text update batch. It can be called in sequence to feed group of documents that share a common document ID and the result is similar to the single call whose text_or_xml
parameter is concatenation of documents of that group. It is even allowed to mix XML and non-XML documents by feeding an XML document and some text documents: the first document to feed may be an XML document, other documents should be only texts.

If one wishes to mix XML and non-XML documents, knowledge of details of the indexing method is needed. vt_batch_feed
assigns a sequence number to every word of the provided document using an internal counter. The call of vt_batch_d_id
not only sets document id but also resets this counter to 0. The first element of an XML document should have number 0 so it is impossible to feed an XML document if there were other calls of vt_batch_feed
after the last vt_batch_d_id
. Moreover, xcontains
will ignore words from text documents that were fed after the first XML document, only contains
will use all data.

refsect2.title: vt_batch
refsect2.para:
must be an object returned by vt_batch
on which
vt_batch_d_id
has been called; e.g. it can be called inside the index hook function

refsect2.title: text_or_xml
refsect2.para: must be a blob, wide blob, varchar, nvarchar or XML entity object.

refsect2.title: is_del
refsect2.para: if 0 means that the data is to be added, 1 means the data is to be deleted.

refsect2.title: is_xml
refsect2.para:
if 1, means that the text_or_xml
must be a well formed XML fragment and that it will be indexed for use with xcontains
. The default is 0 that means "plain text".

refsect1.title: Examples
refsect1.para:
Please refer to examples for function vt_batch_feed_offband()
.
